metadata.bijbeltekst: The Parable of the Tenants (implied Matthew 21 / Mark 12 / Luke 20)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (the Owner) establishes a kingdom (vineyard) which is assaulted by a powerful Kingdom of Evil. Despite the murder of servants and the Son, God persists in His plan to reclaim the vineyard and sustain His people.

tekstueel_bewijs: He will pull down those evil men, and he will put other tenants in their place.
He will have other servants and will raise up that Son whom wicked men slew.

object.identificatie: The Vineyard / The Kingdom / The survival and faithfulness of the Church
tekstueel_bewijs: He let it out to some keepers... He sent a servant to get his portion, his rightful due.
God will not be defeated; his people will not be defeated.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Black Community / The King Family
tekstueel_bewijs: Christians tell the world, 'They won't be able to kill us off.'
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: The Son / The Spirit (implied in the singing choir) / The New Tenants
tekstueel_bewijs: On Christ the Solid Rock I stand.
A. D.'s third son came to me... he is going to preach.
helper.rol_van_god: God is Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Son.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Kingdom of Evil / Greed / The 'Merchants of Hate'
tekstueel_bewijs: There is powerful kingdom of evil... mightier than we think.
bullets ring out through the sanctuary.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The preacher explicitly rejects a purely psychological or social view of evil, calling it a 'powerful kingdom' that only God can match.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The community's responsibility to purge the 'poisoned atmosphere' and stop contributing to the climate of contempt.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearers / The Black Church members
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Gun control / Respect for the church / Moral integrity
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon begins with human failure (Secondary) but concludes that only the Primary Program (God's action) can resolve the 'Why' of the tragedy.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → The Vineyard/Kingdom → The Faithful Remnant
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Son/Preachers → God ← Kingdom of Evil/Greed

voorbeelden_god_subject: He will pull down those evil men.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have paraded conspicuous display of prosperity.
We have not been serious Christians.

voorbeelden: God must be asked to forgive us this morning.
They won't be able to kill us off.
Everybody knows that guns can be bought too easily.
I do not know the servant's name.
we cannot deliver ourselves from evil.
They won't be able to kill us off.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God versus the 'Non-Pouvoir' (Inability) of humans to defeat cosmic evil.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Murder), moves to ~S1 (Community guilt), attempts ~S2 (Gun laws), but concludes that only S1 (God's intervention) can negate S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved eschatologically: God replaces the tenants and raises the Son.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; evil is treated as a cosmic force, not just a mistake.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the first half is heavily law-oriented and self-critical, the 'engine' of the sermon is theocentric. The resolution depends entirely on God's 'Pouvoir' and His refusal to be defeated.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: American people... have shown no interest in outlawing guns, Have you? Have I?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: we cannot deliver ourselves from evil. It is so powerful that only God... can match it.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Elijah, Isaiah) are not used as moral examples for us to follow, but as victims of evil whom God vindicates.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who sends and God is the one who restores.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from guilt/shock to defiant hope.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is grounded in God's faithfulness, not human social progress.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from social critique to cosmic narrative is handled via the 'Why' question.
spanning_punten: The shift from gun control (political) to the 'Kingdom of Evil' (metaphysical) creates a slight structural jar.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God will not be defeated... he will raise up that Son whom wicked men slew.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is implied in the 'singing' and the 'preaching' of the next generation.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully shifts the Subject from 'We' (who failed to pass laws) to 'God' (who cannot be defeated).

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might get stuck in the 'guilt' of the poisoned atmosphere.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The 'New Tenants' or the 'Choir' who sings despite the blood.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the choir's ability to sing is a gift from the Subject (God).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong Devoir (must) in the first half.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: More Pouvoir (God's enablement) in the social critique section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the inability to pass gun laws to the need for God's power earlier.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent is sufficiently cosmic and terrifying.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (Lament -> Law -> Gospel) is effective.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of moving from a tragic human event to a deep theocentric narrative without bypassing the pain.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the pathos of the King family; Greimas reveals the underlying shift from human political agency to divine cosmic agency.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the vineyard context; Greimas shows how the 'Vineyard' actant functions as a placeholder for the Black Church in 1974.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Why' is answered not by a reason, but by a change in Subject (from Man to God).

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic 'Christus Victor' narrative where the Opponent appears to win (S2) but is negated by the Subject's superior Pouvoir.
